title: [ISSUE #5392] [RIP-55] Support remoting protocol in rocketmq proxy module
body:
Close #5392
Close #5486
Close #5485
Close #5406

## What is the purpose of the change

Support remoting protocol in the rocketmq proxy module, including the rocketmq-client which version >= 4.9.5 for 4.9.x branch and version >= 5.0.1 for develop branch.

## Brief changelog

See [wiki](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/wiki/RIP-55-Support-remoting-protocol-in-rocketmq-proxy-module) for more information.

Including three parts.

1. Remoting server implementation and protocol negotiation for both remoting and gRPC protocol.
2. Connection module: Including heartbeat management and synchronization.
3. Message module: Including sending and receiving messages implemented by request to the corresponding broker.

title: [Issue #5569]Support broker priority election for controller mode
body:
**Make sure set the target branch to `develop`**

## What is the purpose of the change

Tracking issue: #4330
Close: #5569
Support broker priority election for controller mode

## Brief changelog

- Add a new config in brokerConfig: brokerElectionPriority, which is an important basis for the controller to choose the broker master. Under the same conditions, the broker with higher priority will be selected as master. You can set a higher priority for the broker with better machine conditions.

- In DefaultElectPolicy, previously we would sort brokers by (epoch, offset), now we will sort by (epoch, offset, electionPriority)

title: [ISSUE #5536] fix:new version name server should be compatible with old version broker
body:
**Make sure set the target branch to `develop`**

## What is the purpose of the change
fixes https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/issues/5536
Make the new name srv compatible with the old broker.
While broker configure compressedRegister=trueif we update the cluster by rolling, upgrading broker after upgrading name server or vice versa, would cause exception as follows:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50660789/202614146-fe8b4c94-b333-41e5-a23f-842164bc55d7.png)

So, we should consider the broker version to decode the register broker body

title: invert dependency between remoting and common module
body:
close #5502 

## Detailed changes

- move org.apache.rocketmq.common.protocol to org.apache.rocketmq.remoting.protocol
- move all classes that extend RemotingSerializable to org.apache.rocketmq.remoting.protocol
- move org.apache.rocketmq.remoting.common.RemotingUtil to org.apache.rocketmq.common.utils.NetworkUtil
- move org.apache.rocketmq.remoting.common.RemotingHelper#exceptionSimpleDesc to org.apache.rocketmq.common.UtilAll#exceptionSimpleDesc
- remove some functions in TopicValidator: no longer handle response in TopicValidator
- fix tests

title: [ISSUE #5472] Add the annotation @Deprecated to the methods that are not used in Class "MonitorService"
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

There is no call to Class org.apache.rocketmq.tools.monitor.MonitorService startup method in the scripts under the bin directory, which means that the main method of class MonitorService will not be executed, so I add the annotation @Deprecated to the methods that are not used in Class "MonitorService".

## Brief changelog

Add the annotation @Deprecated to the methods that are not used in Class "MonitorService".

## Verifying this change

Trivial changes: This pr only adds the annotation @Deprecated and does not involve logic code modification.
I have runmvn clean install to make sure unit-test pass.

title: [ISSUE #5430] Remove redundant null check
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Remove the null check for topicData in HookUtils. Fix the typo for variable tranformRes to transformRes.
Resolves https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/issues/5430.

## Brief changelog
Remove redundant null check and fix typo.
